text:
1) Create a test plan
2) Add a Web Service/SOAP (beta code) request configured with :
   - field WSDL URL empty
   - field URL filled (it is mandatory...)
3) add any listener for displaying results
3) run the test plan

In test results, the request appears but field "URL" is blank. I would expect
the field to display the web service URL. When displaying the results, maybe
there is a confusion between the web service URL and the WSDL URL.
creator: theshaman@laposte.net

text:
if the webservice is a ASP or ASMX webservice on .NET, you need to populate the
soapAction. If the soapAction is emtpy, it will not get valid response. In fact,
the .NET webservice will reject the request.

if the webservice is java, please attach a test plan so I can debug it. thanks.

peter
creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
theshaman@laposte.net
text:
Hi Peter,
Sorry but for security reasons I don't want to attach ma test plan, and I have
no songle web application to create another one...
To answer your questions, it is a java web service, I filled the SOAP Action and
the test plan works fine, the server sends the expected response.
I replayed the test with the field WSDL URL not empty, and again the test
results shows a blank URL, so forget my idea about the confusion between WSDL
URL and real web service URL...

creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
So are you still having problems?

Currently, the sampler does not save the WSDL URL, only the webservice URL used
to process the request. I'll update the sampler this week to save the WSDL URL.
Although it isn't used at runtime, there's no harm in saving that in the test
plan. I forget exactly why i decided not to save the wsdl url. adding that
feature should be simple.

peter

creator: theshaman@laposte.net
text:
Sorry if I have difficulties to explain my problem, english is not my native
language...
To sum up my situation :
- I never had difficulties to run my test plan (all the web service requests are
well processed)
- I don't give much interest to the field WSDL URL : I let it empty, so it does
not bother me whether the field is saved or not 
- if I look the test results, all the requests appear but, and it is my
"problem", the column URL is empty, so it is not easy to know which row is which
web service request. I would like this column to show the web service URL. It is
just a little problem and it will not prevent me from using JMeter...

Thanks for the time you spend in trying to understand me!

creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
thanks for taking time to explain the problem. for some stupid reason I thought
you were having problems with sending requests. I will look at the sampler and
double check the implementation. It most likely isn't setting the url in the
sample result, so adding that should be relatively easy to do.

peter

creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
I've updated the webservice sampler to include the response header and set the 
label for the sample result. Tonight i will check it into CVS. thanks again for 
reporting the bug and taking time to explain it.

peter
